page.title: 08POLICE IN ALSAGER
page.content: Two policeman work at a time in Alsager together with a Panda car and a Traffic car. The crime rate in Alsager is below the national average and the most common crime is burglary. Of course if there is a crime someone must write the reports which must contain all the facts of the incident. Policing is easier now as the police now use computers which can flash a message from one end of the country to the other. The police station in Alsager is small and over seventy years old. The conditions there are very good. The police in Alsager are controlled by the police station in Congleton which also controls Holmes Chapel, Sandbach, etc. The vehicles are liked by the policemen and are changed every three years. The panda cars in Alsager are Chevettes and the traffic cars are Rovers. By R.Kehoe.
